intro: Thlaspi amarum, commonly known as bitter cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing herb that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and small, upright flowering stems that bear clusters of small, yellow flowers. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Thlaspi amarum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is sometimes used in phytoremediation due to its tolerance for heavy metals.
